title: METHOD OF PRODUCING OXIDE PARTICLES, SLURRY, POLISHING SLURRY, AND METHOD OF POLISHING SUBSTRATE

samples.experiment_context: Production of cerium oxide from cerium carbonate.8H2O (100g) and succinic acid (52g). Heated at 750°C for 1h. Oxide (~50g yield) confirmed by XRD. SEM of powder in FIG. 1. Slurry made with 40g oxide, 1g (40 mass %) ammonium polyacrylate, 759g water. Pulverized for 30min (Microfluidizer). Avg particle size in slurry 300nm. No coarse particles/abrasion powder in dried slurry by SEM.

post_synthesis_treatment.oxide_identity_confirmation_method: X-ray diffractometry (confirmed to be cerium oxide)

additives.name: ammonium polyacrylate
additives.details: Added as 1g of 40 mass % aqueous solution

particle_size_distribution.measurement_method_used: laser diffraction particle size distribution analyzer (Mastersizer Micro Plus)
particle_size_distribution.note: Average particle diameter in obtained slurry

characterization.particle_morphology_in_dried_slurry_sem: Coarse particles of 3 μm or more or particles other than cerium oxide considered as abrasion powder were not recognized.

samples.experiment_context: Production of mixed cerium/lanthanum oxide from cerium carbonate.8H2O (90g), lanthanum carbonate hydrate (10g), and malonic acid (45g). Heated at 750°C for 1h. Oxide (~50g yield) confirmed by XRD. SEM of powder in FIG. 16. Slurry prepared. Avg particle size 220nm. No coarse particles/abrasion powder.
samples.precursor_chemical: Cerium Carbonate and Lanthanum Carbonate mixture

post_synthesis_treatment.oxide_identity_confirmation_method: X-ray diffractometry (confirmed to be a mixture of cerium oxide and lanthanum oxide)

slurry_preparation.abrasive_material_source: Cerium/Lanthanum oxide mixture from this synthesis

additives.name: ammonium polyacrylate
additives.details: Added as 1g of 40 mass % aqueous solution

particle_size_distribution.measurement_method_used: laser diffraction particle size distribution analyzer (Mastersizer Micro Plus)
particle_size_distribution.note: Average particle diameter in obtained slurry

characterization.particle_morphology_in_dried_slurry_sem: Coarse particles of 3 μM or more or particles considered as abrasion powder other than cerium oxide or lanthanum oxide were not recognized.

samples.experiment_context: Production of cerium oxide from commercial cerium carbonate (6kg) and oxalic acid.2H2O (3.3kg). Mixed 5min (shaker). Heated 800°C, 2h. Yield 3kg. Slurry: 1000g oxide, 80g (40%) ammonium polyacrylate, 5600g water. Wet-milled (bead mill, 30min). Settled 20h, supernatant filtered (1.0um x2). Final solid content 5%. D50=190nm, D99=0.7um. Coarse particles (>=3um) 300ppm. CMP: Rate 650nm/min, 20 scratches.
samples.molar_ratio_precursor_precipitant: 0.5 to 6 (general claim for oxalic acid, specific inputs: 6kg carbonate, 3.3kg oxalic acid.2H2O)

mixing_of_reactants.container: polyethylene container with gas venting hole

pulverization_and_dispersion.method: wet-milled with a bead mill (manufactured by Ashizawa Finetec)

post_synthesis_treatment.oxide_identity_confirmation_method: X-ray diffractometry (phase identification confirmed cerium oxide)

slurry_preparation.processing_steps: Stirred 10 mins, wet-milled 30 mins (bead mill), dispersion left at RT for 20 hours, supernatant collected, filtered with 1.0 μm filter (twice), adjusted with deionized water to 5% solid content.

particle_size_distribution.measurement_method_used: laser diffraction particle size distribution analyzer (Mastersizer Micro Plus)

coarse_particle_content.measurement_method: Filtration through 3-μm filter (Cyclopore Track Etch Membrane Filter)

cmp_performance.scratches_observed: 20 on whole area (200 mm) of wafer
cmp_performance.polishing_pad: Foamed polyurethane resin (IC-1000, manufactured by Rodel Inc.)

samples.experiment_context: Cerium oxide from Ex.17 (1000g) processed similarly but settled for 100h, supernatant filtered (0.7um x2). Final solid content 5%. D50=160nm, D99=0.5um. Coarse particles (>=3um) 20ppm. CMP: Rate 350nm/min, 10 scratches.

precursor_details.formulation: commercial cerium carbonate (same batch as Ex. 17)

quantity.value: N/A for this step, oxide from Ex.17 used

pulverization_and_dispersion.method: wet-milled with a bead mill (manufactured by Ashizawa Finetec)

slurry_preparation.processing_steps: Stirred 10 mins, wet-milled 30 mins (bead mill), dispersion left at RT for 100 hours, supernatant collected, filtered with 0.7 μm filter (twice), adjusted with deionized water to 5% solid content.

particle_size_distribution.measurement_method_used: laser diffraction particle size distribution analyzer (Mastersizer Micro Plus)

cmp_performance.scratches_observed: 10 on whole area (200 mm) of wafer
